Articles.Content:
will Charrs lava lakes be lava, or act like regular water, just asking cuz i imagine something like that wasnt added yet

Possibly be water that destroys you immediately... Or quite quickly at least

will Charrs lava lakes be lava, or act like regular water, just asking cuz i imagine something like that wasnt added yet

It will probably cause a massive overheat of anything that touches (or maybe goes near) the lava.

Could Please You Not Go Off Topic? It's Kind Of Annoying.

Yeah... Why are you talking like that? That's annoying.

-TO KEEP THIS POST ON TOPIC, please enjoy a forced sentence about .17 that I didn't need-

I'm going to look for life on the desert planet with probes.

I have a suggestion for the name of the desert planet. Hopefully Nova reads this:

How about Descartes?

The Descartes highlands were Apollo 16's landing site on the Moon and it has the prefix "des" for desert.
How's about Eremus? Desert/Wasteland in latin
Eremus actually sounds perfect. I like that idea.

Nice layout but the gas giant is nearly as big as kerbol.

Yes, well Kerbals' heads are nearly as big as the rest of their bodies. Wait no, they're bigger.

I don't want to offend anyone but I think the communication for the last update 0.16 of the developers was better than now with 0.17.

Nova is giving us some pictures which are very nice and big thanks for that.

But what I would appreciate very much if the other developers would make a dev-blog or else for us so we can get a little information of whats going on.

You made a great game so far and I think we all are more than just very interested in what is going on.

Greetings
Nova~ Will any celestial body be orbiting retrograde?

Nova~ Will any celestial body be orbiting retrograde?

I don't think that's physically possible.

Just orbiting in the opposite direction the sun rotates in is rare enough, but orbiting in a different direction than all the other planets in the same solar system would make its orbit way too unstable.
No one said anything about Kerbol being different from the potatomoon picture. Kerbol looks more realistic now but it looks quite small from such a close distance...

I don't really mind if it's orbit is slightly unstable, but it's entirely possible, The odds of a extrasolar capture occurring are rather slim, but not so small that they cannot occur at all. Even just having a retrograde moon would be fun, as landing on it will be a different experience and also a change of pace.

I don't want to offend anyone but I think the communication for the last update 0.16 of the developers was better than now with 0.17.

Nova is giving us some pictures which are very nice and big thanks for that.

But what I would appreciate very much if the other developers would make a dev-blog or else for us so we can get a little information of whats going on.

You made a great game so far and I think we all are more than just very interested in what is going on.

Greetings

That's fair enough, but the 0.17 update official thread says this is a less major update so maybe that is a contributing factor....

Im also wondering how the lava will be implemented.. will heat be introduced? or will it be a lethal water... because if it is a lethal water im wondering how it will be for crafts flying over.. if they will be able to or not... hmmm

*Sings* Im so excited *Sings*
Recently I have been playing around with space planes so I think the visual cues of thrust, lift, and drag are going to be really helpful

Kerbol looks more realistic now but it looks quite small from such a close distance...

And who said Eve was closer to the sun than Kerbin?

And who said Eve was closer to the sun than Kerbin?

Quote from damion rayne

it's the following..

Kerbol

Lava Planet

Venus Analog (Eve)

Mars Analog (Red Planet)

Kerbin

Gas Giant 1

I don't want to offend anyone but I think the communication for the last update 0.16 of the developers was better than now with 0.17.

Nova is giving us some pictures which are very nice and big thanks for that.

But what I would appreciate very much if the other developers would make a dev-blog or else for us so we can get a little information of whats going on.

You made a great game so far and I think we all are more than just very interested in what is going on.

Greetings

It's not that we don't want to keep dev blogs anymore, the reason we haven't been posting regular updates is because we are still waiting on the forum overhaul to be completed (it's still half-way through). We are going to add proper in-forum dev blogs, and we've been waiting for that to start posting our updates again.

What we don't want to do anymore is use normal threads to post info, because even with the locked-thread system we adopted on the 0.16 update, we still saw that people couldn't find information, and there was no organized place to hold discussions. With a blog + comments format, all that should be solved, which is why we are waiting for that to start the dev blogs again.

Cheers

Quote from damion rayne

it's the following..

Kerbol

Lava Planet

Venus Analog (Eve)

Mars Analog (Red Planet)

Kerbin

Gas Giant 1

I thought that was just his guess, and I still think it is.

EDIT: Oh nevermind I found it and your right xD Sorry for causing trouble.

Edited September 11, 2012 by swiftgates24
If it was a guess why would he correct someone for putting the desert planet after kerbin.

Well, if they really can't find a devblog thread if you put it in KSP Development, they're not even trying

Looking forward to this new feature.

Aha! I edited it before you could read it so logic just exploded

BTW Harv, congrats on your 3,000 post
I know it's very unlikely, but it'd be really awesome if we could change the orbit of the small potatoe-like moon by either crashing things into it or thrusting downwards directly into the moon.
So Kerbin is the 4th planet in the Kerbolsystem? Interesting.

It's not that we don't want to keep dev blogs anymore, the reason we haven't been posting regular updates is because we are still waiting on the forum overhaul to be completed (it's still half-way through). We are going to add proper in-forum dev blogs, and we've been waiting for that to start posting our updates again.

What we don't want to do anymore is use normal threads to post info, because even with the locked-thread system we adopted on the 0.16 update, we still saw that people couldn't find information, and there was no organized place to hold discussions. With a blog + comments format, all that should be solved, which is why we are waiting for that to start the dev blogs again.

Cheers

Big Thanks for the info HarvesteR. I'm looking forward to see your Blogs or so once everything is overhauled.

I mean hey you are the one who is responsible that I'm now addicted to KSP. Thanks again for that and your great game. xD

Edited August 13, 2012 by blspblackdeath
Sorry if this seems stupid, but I'm a little confused, I was watching the livestream on Friday and I couldn't tell are we actually getting a Kurt Kerman in .17 or was that a joke I couldn't tell.
